restrict_scalars:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
theorem is_symmetric.restrict_scalars {T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E} (hT : T.is_symmetric) :
    @linear_map.is_symmetric (exprℝ) E _ (inner_product_space.is_R_or_C_to_real 𝕜 E)
      (@linear_map.restrict_scalars (exprℝ) 𝕜 _ _ _ _ _ _ (inner_product_space.is_R_or_C_to_real 𝕜 E).to_module
        (inner_product_space.is_R_or_C_to_real 𝕜 E).to_module _ _ _ T) :=
  fun x y => by simp [hT x y, real_inner_eq_re_inner, linear_map.coe_restrict_scalars_eq_coe]
#align is_symmetric.restrict_scalars is_symmetric.restrict_scalars
restrict_invariant:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/-- If a symmetric operator preserves a submodule, its restriction to that submodule is
symmetric. -/
theorem is_symmetric.restrict_invariant {T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E} (hT : is_symmetric T) {V : submodule 𝕜 E}
    (hV : ∀ v ∈ V, T v ∈ V) : is_symmetric (T.restrict hV) := fun v w => hT v w
#align is_symmetric.restrict_invariant is_symmetric.restrict_invariant
is_symmetric_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
theorem is_symmetric_zero : (0 : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E).is_symmetric := fun x y =>
  (inner_zero_right : «expr⟪ , ⟫» x 0 = 0).symm ▸ (inner_zero_left : «expr⟪ , ⟫» 0 y = 0)
#align is_symmetric_zero is_symmetric_zero
is_symmetric_iff_sesq_form:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/-
Copyright (c) 2022 Anatole Dedecker. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Moritz Doll, Frédéric Dupuis, Heather Macbeth
-/
/-- An operator `T` on an inner product space is symmetric if and only if it is
`linear_map.is_self_adjoint` with respect to the sesquilinear form given by the inner product. -/
theorem is_symmetric_iff_sesq_form (T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E) :
    T.is_symmetric ↔ @linear_map.is_self_adjoint 𝕜 E _ _ _ (starRingEnd 𝕜) sesq_form_of_inner T :=
  ⟨fun h x y => (h y x).symm, fun h x y => (h y x).symm⟩
#align is_symmetric_iff_sesq_form is_symmetric_iff_sesq_form
is_symmetric_iff_inner_map_self_real:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℂ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `star_ring_end -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫_ℂ» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫_ℂ» -/
/-- A linear operator on a complex inner product space is symmetric precisely when
`⟪T v, v⟫_ℂ` is real for all v.-/
theorem is_symmetric_iff_inner_map_self_real (T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » V (exprℂ) V) :
    is_symmetric T ↔ ∀ v : V, (star_ring_end) («expr⟪ , ⟫_ℂ» (T v) v) = «expr⟪ , ⟫_ℂ» (T v) v :=
  by
  constructor
  · intro hT v
    apply is_symmetric.conj_inner_sym hT
  · intro h x y
    nth_rw 2 [← inner_conj_sym]
    nth_rw 2 [inner_map_polarization]
    simp only [starRingEnd_apply, star_div', star_sub, star_add, star_mul]
    simp only [← starRingEnd_apply]
    rw [h (x + y), h (x - y), h (x + «expr • » complex.I y), h (x - «expr • » complex.I y)]
    simp only [complex.conj_I]
    rw [inner_map_polarization']
    norm_num
    ring
#align is_symmetric_iff_inner_map_self_real is_symmetric_iff_inner_map_self_real
is_symmetric_id:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
theorem is_symmetric_id : (linear_map.id : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E).is_symmetric := fun x y => rfl
#align is_symmetric_id is_symmetric_id
continuous:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/-- The **Hellinger--Toeplitz theorem**: if a symmetric operator is defined on a complete space,
  then it is automatically continuous. -/
theorem is_symmetric.continuous [complete_space E] {T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E} (hT : is_symmetric T) : continuous T :=
  by
  -- We prove it by using the closed graph theorem
  refine' T.continuous_of_seq_closed_graph fun u x y hu hTu => _
  rw [← sub_eq_zero, ← inner_self_eq_zero]
  have hlhs : ∀ k : ℕ, «expr⟪ , ⟫» (T (u k) - T x) (y - T x) = «expr⟪ , ⟫» (u k - x) (T (y - T x)) :=
    by
    intro k
    rw [← T.map_sub, hT]
  refine' tendsto_nhds_unique ((hTu.sub_const _).inner tendsto_const_nhds) _
  simp_rw [hlhs]
  rw [← @inner_zero_left 𝕜 E _ _ (T (y - T x))]
  refine' filter.tendsto.inner _ tendsto_const_nhds
  rw [← sub_self x]
  exact hu.sub_const _
#align is_symmetric.continuous is_symmetric.continuous
conj_inner_sym:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `star_ring_end -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
theorem is_symmetric.conj_inner_sym {T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E} (hT : is_symmetric T) (x y : E) :
    (star_ring_end) («expr⟪ , ⟫» (T x) y) = «expr⟪ , ⟫» (T y) x := by rw [hT x y, inner_conj_sym]
#align is_symmetric.conj_inner_sym is_symmetric.conj_inner_sym
coe_re_apply_inner_self_apply:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →L[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/-- For a symmetric operator `T`, the function `λ x, ⟪T x, x⟫` is real-valued. -/
@[simp]
theorem is_symmetric.coe_re_apply_inner_self_apply {T : «expr →L[ ] » E 𝕜 E}
    (hT : is_symmetric (T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E)) (x : E) : (T.re_apply_inner_self x : 𝕜) = «expr⟪ , ⟫» (T x) x :=
  by
  rsuffices ⟨r, hr⟩ : ∃ r : exprℝ, «expr⟪ , ⟫» (T x) x = r
  · simp [hr, T.re_apply_inner_self_apply]
  rw [← eq_conj_iff_real]
  exact hT.conj_inner_sym x x
#align is_symmetric.coe_re_apply_inner_self_apply is_symmetric.coe_re_apply_inner_self_apply
apply_clm:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →L[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⟪ , ⟫» -/
@[simp]
theorem is_symmetric.apply_clm {T : «expr →L[ ] » E 𝕜 E} (hT : is_symmetric (T : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E)) (x y : E) :
    «expr⟪ , ⟫» (T x) y = «expr⟪ , ⟫» x (T y) :=
  hT x y
#align is_symmetric.apply_clm is_symmetric.apply_clm
add:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₗ[ ] » -/
theorem is_symmetric.add {T S : «expr →ₗ[ ] » E 𝕜 E} (hT : T.is_symmetric) (hS : S.is_symmetric) :
    (T + S).is_symmetric := by
  intro x y
  rw [linear_map.add_apply, inner_add_left, hT x y, hS x y, ← inner_add_right]
  rfl
#align is_symmetric.add is_symmetric.add
